snippet: New world rankings released Thursday have Spain, Germany, Argentina, Colombia, Belgium, Uruguay and Switzerland in the top seven, joining host Brazil.
abstract: FIFA releases the newest edition of its world rankings, following changes to its seeding formula; revealing the seven teams that will comprise Pot 1 when the final draw for World Cup is held in Salvador, Brazil, on Dec 6; top seven, which will join host Brazil as the top seeds in the eight first-round groups, are, Spain, Germany, Argentina, Colombia, Belgium, Uruguay and Switzerland.
lead_paragraph: New world rankings released Thursday have Spain, Germany, Argentina, Colombia, Belgium, Uruguay and Switzerland in the top seven, joining host Brazil.

headline.main: FIFA Rankings Set Top World Cup Seeds
headline.print_headline: FIFA Names Top Seeds for World Cup

keywords.value: United States Men's National Soccer Team
keywords.name: organizations
